articles.author: Jason Farago
articles.title: Now Virtual and in Video, Museum Websites Shake Off the Dust - The New York Times
articles.description: Homebound and feeling the wanderlust? Our critic’s guide to the best online presentations from the world’s leading art palaces and picture galleries.
articles.content: In times of adversity, we look to art to give form to chaos. But where do you go when the chaos keeps you from art entirely? It will have to be online. As the coronavirus pandemic stretches into yet another month, keeping arts institutions closed across the g… [+11520 chars]

articles.author: Joan E. Solsman
articles.title: HBO Max: Launch date, prices, shows and movies to expect - CNET
articles.description: HBO Max will launch May 27 with HBO's programs and movies, licensed hits and exclusive originals (at least, the ones that aren't delayed by coronavirus).
articles.content:
HBO Max promises a lot.
Screenshot by CNET
HBO Max, the HBO-anchored streaming service finally announced to be launching May 27, has much in common with its competitors in the streaming wars like Disney Plus and Peacock, not to mention Netflix. Like those, … [+18823 chars]

articles.author: Julia Alexander
articles.title: Netflix nabs exclusive Pokémon episodes in latest move to dominate children’s television - The Verge

articles.content:
A staple of kids entertainment on cable is now a streaming exclusive

articles.author: James Crowley
articles.title: Even the Insane Clown Posse Isn't Insane Enough to Gather This Year - Newsweek
articles.description: For the first time in its 20-year history, the Gathering of the Juggalos has been canceled, due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
articles.content:
It's a sad day for Juggalos and Juggalettes as the Insane Clown Posse has announced that it will be canceling its annual music festival, The Gathering of the Juggalos, due to the coronavirus pandemic.

articles.author: Karen Han
articles.title: Watch the trailer for Jerry Seinfeld’s first original comedy special in 22 years - Polygon
articles.description: In 23 Hours to Kill, Jerry Seinfeld returns to stand-up, releasing his first original comedy special in 22 years. The special’s release date on Netflix is May 5.
articles.content: 23 Hours to Kill hits Netflix on May 5

articles.title: Inside the hunt for the stolen Van Gogh - Quartz
articles.description: The art world's most notorious cops and robbers discuss the recent theft, and what happens next.
articles.content:
